name: Phoenix
fun_fact: Fun fact: The Sonoran hot dog was invented in the Phoenix-Tucson corridor by Mexican immigrants who wrapped bacon around a hot dog and loaded it with pinto beans, onions, tomatoes, jalapeÃ±os, and mayo in a bolillo bread - it's now Arizona's signature street food!

hero_dishes.name: Sonoran Hot Dog
hero_dishes.description: Bacon-wrapped hot dog in a soft bolillo roll, topped with pinto beans, onions, tomatoes, jalapeÃ±os, mustard, mayo, and often fresh salsa verde
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created by Mexican vendors in the 1980s-90s, blending American hot dogs with Mexican street food traditions. Now found at dozens of dedicated stands
hero_dishes.where_to_find: El GÃ¼ero Canelo (Tucson, James Beard Award), Nogales Hot Dogs, street vendors citywide

hero_dishes.name: Chimichanga
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried burrito - essentially a burrito that took a bath in hot oil
hero_dishes.origin_story: Possibly invented in Arizona (Tucson and Phoenix both claim it). The story says a burrito accidentally fell into the fryer
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Macayo's (claims invention), El Charro CafÃ©, Mexican restaurants citywide

hero_dishes.name: Cheese Crisp
hero_dishes.description: Thin flour tortilla covered with melted cheese, baked until crispy - Arizona's quesadilla
hero_dishes.origin_story: A Sonoran specialty that's more like a pizza than a quesadilla - thin, crispy, and often huge
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Los Sombreros, Carolina's Mexican Food, traditional Arizona Mexican restaurants

hero_dishes.name: Navajo Fry Bread
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried dough that puffs up into pillowy bread, served sweet or savory
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created by Navajo people in the 1860s using government-issued flour rations. Now cultural icon served as Navajo tacos
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Fry Bread House, Native American cultural events, state fairs

signature_drinks.name: Prickly Pear Margarita
signature_drinks.description: Margarita made with prickly pear cactus fruit, giving it a stunning magenta color
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At sunset patios throughout Scottsdale and Phoenix - the color matches Arizona sunsets

signature_drinks.name: Arizona Craft Beer
signature_drinks.description: Desert brewing scene is thriving with local hops and citrus-forward styles
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: At Four Peaks, Arizona Wilderness, or rooftop bars with mountain views

food_culture_notes: Sonoran Mexican food differs from Tex-Mex - more grilled meats, flour tortillas, beans
Phoenix is America's 5th largest city with food to match
Date palms produce local dates used in many desserts and shakes
Year-round outdoor dining thanks to 300+ days of sunshine
